page.title: 14A Day in the Life of Joanne
page.content: At 8.45 a.m. I set off for School which starts at 9.15. The bell goes and we walk into class. Mr. Hughes marks the register and tells us that Mrs. Keeling is coming in the afternoon to show us some of her animals. Tina and I take the dinner book to each class so that Mrs. Wright, our cook, weill know how many are staying for dinner. Tina and I give out the hymn books at Assembly, and then we have English and Maths until dinner time. After dinner-play it is quiet time and I read my book called "Gemma Alone". Then Mrs. Keeling talks about the owl, salamander, rat and snake she has brought. I like the owl best. During the last lesson the boys play cricket and the girls play rounders. We all go home at 3.45.
